metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2006 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: C API). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.19 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Client. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-router - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-1').
